alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 9:59AM CST until January 28 at 5:45AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Colorado River at Wharton affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. For the Colorado River...including Columbus, Wharton, Bay City, Matagorda...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River at Wharton. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage as numerous streets in west and southwest Wharton are inundated and the lowest homes threatened. The JDIN Recreational Center in southwest Wharton close to being isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Thursday the stage was 31.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 42.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.8 feet on 05/31/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Colorado River Wharton 39.0 31.5 Thu 9 am CST 41.7 41.2 27.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening.late tonight at 400 AM CST.
